messages.content: You are an expert chef and experienced cook, you specialize in Indian spicy food
Give me recipe for Paneer Butter Masala

Ingredients:

For the Paneer Marinade:

250g paneer, cut into cubes
1/2 cup yogurt
1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste
1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
1 teaspoon red chili powder
Salt to taste
For the Gravy:

2 tablespoons butter
1 tablespoon oil
1 cup onion, finely chopped
1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste
1 cup tomato puree
1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked in water
1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste)
1 teaspoon garam masala
1 teaspoon coriander powder
1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
Salt to taste
1 cup water (adjust for desired consistency)
2 tablespoons fresh cream
1 teaspoon sugar (optional, to balance the acidity of tomatoes)
For Garnish:

Fresh coriander leaves, chopped
1 tablespoon butter (optional)
Instructions:

Marinate the Paneer:

In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add paneer cubes to the marinade, ensuring each piece is well-coated.
Allow it to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Prepare the Cashew Paste:

Grind the soaked cashew nuts into a smooth paste using a little water. Set aside.
Cook the Paneer:

Heat 1 tablespoon of butter in a pan and fry the marinated paneer cubes until they turn golden brown. Set aside.
Prepare the Gravy:

In the same pan, add 1 tablespoon of oil and another tablespoon of butter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears.
Add tomato puree and cook until the oil starts to separate from the masala.
Add red chili powder, garam masala, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
Finish the Curry:

Add the cashew paste and mix well.
Pour in water to achieve the desired consistency and bring the curry to a simmer.
Add the fried paneer cubes and cook for a few more minutes.
Stir in fresh cream and sugar (if using) to balance the flavors.
Garnish and Serve:

Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and a dollop of butter.
Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.
Enjoy your homemade Paneer Butter Masala
